utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi, I've just had a runny nose and a cough for the past uh week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um so for the past week you said, did the cough start first, or the runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh it started with the cough. I usually don't come in when I have symptoms like this uh, but I've just been, uhm, I just heard of someone who passed away due to Covid and I'm just like very scared and I just decided to come in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure that's understandable. Um With the cough, is it a dry cough or are you bringing up some phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um it's mostly a dry cough

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Dry cough. OK, um and is it persistent or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It comes and goes. It does get better when I um take um like over the counter medications for for um like the antitussive pills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah yeah. Um and does anything make it worse like the cold air or certain times of the day or like when you're laying down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um the cold air does make it a little bit uh worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you experienced something like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I usually I do get a cold um couple times a year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, that makes sense. Um and any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um, how about a stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I do have a stuffy nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when your nose does run, do you notice that it's like uh yellow in colour or red?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, so it's clear?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's clear, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I I can't smell as as much, but I think maybe it's just because my nose is so stuffy, but also that made me a little bit concerned about Covid, but no problems with taste.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good any weight loss recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I've been trying to lose weight, but nothing unintentional I guess.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, and then any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No fevers huh, OK. Any like excessive fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am tired but not, I guess it's not too bad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah OK, and how about like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed any.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No rashes, OK. Um any uh, sorry, I asked you if you had chest pain, uh do you ever feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Any changes to your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, um nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Uhm how about headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Fainting spells or dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Joint pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just my body feels a little achy, but.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No like specific joint pains.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then any uh major illnesses that are longstanding?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I don't know does depression count? I do have depression.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, for sure. How, when were you diagnosed with depression?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh when I was 15 years old.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: 15, OK. Um are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm I'm on Prozac.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Prozac, OK. And when were you diagnosed uh, prescribed that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I've just been on different medications uh over the past few years. Um this one seems to be working well. I started this about a year ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK good good, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Mhmm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um any family history of lung or heart disease?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, just um high cholesterol.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um how about smoking, do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um any other recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, sometimes. I'll just have a joint um maybe um two or three times a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And is that for like medical purposes or just like recreationally?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh just you know just to relax.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sure. Um alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And have you been around any sick people recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I went to I went grocery shopping and and someone near me was coughing. I was still like six, you know, I was away from them but, I don't like, yeah, I don't know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. I think that you're, it's fair that you're concerned about that. And how about travel to anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't traveled anywhere.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. OK, well those are all the questions I had for you. Did you have any questions of your own?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. So we'll do a covid swab anyways today because your, some of your symptoms do overlap with that of Covid and you should hear back in about 24 to 48 hours. But in the meantime you should self isolate for 14 days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um but it I think it does really sound like you have a common cold um so just like another viral illness, um so just treat it supportively you know um keep yourself hydrated, if you feel like you're getting a fever, take like Tylenol. Um if you have like pain like a headache or like sinus pressure or something you can take again an Advil or Tylenol. Um And if your symptoms worsen, or if you have any neurological symptoms, then you should see the ER um right away.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK sounds good.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
